org.svvrl.goal.core.util

Class Permutation<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.util.Permutation<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of elements

    public class Permutation<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides methods for computing all permutations of an array (with size smaller than 17) based on [E. W. Dijkstra, A Discipline of Programming, Prentice-Hall, 1976, p.71].
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Permutation(T[] s, java.util.Comparator<T> c)
      Constructor with an array to be permuted and a comparator for comparing elements in the array.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<T> getNext()
      Returns the next permutation.
      boolean hasNext()
      Returns true if there are permutations not generated.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Permutation

        public Permutation(T[] s,
                   java.util.Comparator<T> c)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor with an array to be permuted and a comparator for comparing elements in the array.
        Parameters:
        s - an array to be permuted
        c - a comparator for comparing elements in source
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length of s is greater than 16
